notesStmt.note: An answer to Dr. Tullies angry letter; Exceptions against a writing of Mr. R. Baxters by Christopher Cartwright; and The substance of Mr. Cartwright's exceptions considered, all have special title pages dated 1675 and separate pagination.
Cartwright's Exceptions (Wing C691) also published separately can can be found at UMI microfilm 862:11.
Reproduction of original in British Library (book 1), Huntington Library (book 2), and Cambridge University Library (both books).

(from t.p.) I. A treatise of imputed righteousness ...with many of Dr. Tullies reasonings against truth ... : with an answer to Dr. Tullies letter adjoyned -- II. A friendly debate with ... Mr. Christopher Cartwright containing 1. his animadversions on my aphorisms with my answer, 2. his exceptions against that answer, 3. my reply to the summe of the controversies agitated in those exceptions.
